intro: Cissus phymatocarpa, commonly known as the rock fig or stone cissus, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellowish berry that contains several seeds. Cissus phymatocarpa is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
